name: Eastern Sun
description:
Introduction

One of the few dry canyons in the Zion area. The deep, narrow gash in the desert floor appears out of nowhere, akin to Englestead, making for a breathtaking view at the first rappel station. One rappel after another, reminiscent of Birch Hollow. If you are on the east side of the park, a good option if you have done all of the 5-star and 4-star canyons. Nothing special here.

Approach

4 miles cross-country, 2 hours 10 minutes at a brisk pace

Descent

R1: Rock Pinch, canyon right, 165 feet, down a dry flute

R2: Rock Pinch, mid-canyon, 40 foot rappel

R3: Rock Pinch, canyon left, 38 foot rappel

R4: Log, mid-canyon, 30 foot rappel

R5: Canyon right, downclimb 20 feet top stage, get on rappel, 20 foot rappel

Then three 20 foot downclimbs. Last one has rock pinch anchor for handline. Dry flute offers plenty of friction.

R6: Deadman, mid-canyon, 20 foot rappel

R7: Deadman, mid-canyon, 45 foot total, 2-stage, top stage over wet pothole can be bridged over. No need to keep feet dry as the hike up the North Fork is right around the bend and your feet will be wet for the next 2 1/2 hours.

Exit

Hike 6 miles up North Fork. Past abandoned hunter's cabin. Through double metal gate. To farmer's pump house on right. Or continue 1/2 mile to drop-off for Narrows Through Hike and bathroom there.

Red tape

Permit is required as the lower end crosses into the National Park boundary.

Beta sites

  • Zion Canyoneering Book by Tom Jones : Eastern Sun
  • BluuGnome.com : Eastern Sun Canyon
  • Super Amazing Map : Eastern Sun

Trip reports and media

8/19/15, 7 hours + 2 hours waiting for shuttle and drive out

Background

First descent made by Kip Marshall, Bruce Snow, Gaydon Leavitt and Tom Jones on 7/29/12

properties.name: Down Climb
properties.description: Downclinmb of about 12 feet moderate difficulty. Below here the canyon begins to get narrow and twisty for a short distance before opening up to wider wash again. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R1
properties.description: Rap 1 is anchored RDC by a pinch point between a boulder and the canyon floor and drops down vertical a fluted wall about 170 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R3
properties.description: Rap 3 is anchored LDC from a white rock protruding from the ground and drops about 40 feet free hanging over some boulders. Rap 4 is about 40 feet down canyon of rap 3. Rap 4 can be anchored from your choice of rock or log debris at the top of the drop. Flooding may change this so you may need to get creative. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Down Climb
properties.description: Downclimb of about 20 feet down a twisted corkscrew like feature. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R6
properties.description: Rap 6 - Eastern Sun Canyon. Drops about 20 feet down a slot and can be downclimbed if you have a good downclimber on your group. Otherwise the drop can be anchored using the tree above the downclimb just before this drop. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R7
properties.description: Rap 7 - Eastern Sun Canyon. Anchored from a cairn anchor and drops about 40 feet down into a short narrow but walkable slot section. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R2
properties.description: Rap 2 is about 40 feet down canyon of rap 1 and drops 35 feet anchored from a log. The log may wash away creating the need to get creative with your anchor. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R8
properties.description: Rap 8 - Eastern Sun Canyon. Anchored froom a cairn anchor; drops about 10 feet over some boulders and can be downclimbed easily if facing RDC. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R4
properties.description: Rap 4 drops 25 to 30 feet over a series of ledges. The first 8 feet of rap 4 is the portion you will need rope for. The lower portions of rap 4 can be downclimbed but are easier using the rope set for that first 8 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R9
properties.description: Rap 9 - Eastern Sun Canyon. Anchored from a log protruding from the wash about 15 feet back and drops over two stages traveling about 65 feet. With the anchor set back you will need about 80 feet of rope travel for rap 9. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R5
properties.description: Rap 5 is about 60 feet down canyon of rap 4 and is anchored by a log and drops about 20 feet. The log anchor may be washed away with flooding. Optionally a large boulder embedded at the top of the drop can be used as the anchor. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Down Climb
properties.description: Sloped shute to downclimb / slide down. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Start Parking
properties.description: Turn off of the North Fork Road on the left as the main road makes a sharp right hand bend. Road sign post labeled as 90 and 92. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Bullochs Cabin
properties.description: Bulloch's Cabin. An old broke down cabin in a meadow just off the road on the south side.
